reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a deluxe room here as a surprise birthday present :-) was a little dubious after reading the comments on trip advisor with regard to poor service......but found the service to be nothing short of excellent!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in idyllic surroundings - something special!

reviews.text: We stayed in the Willow Room, a beautiful spacious room with a big comfortable bed (albeit a duvet thick enough to hibernate under!!) , traditional decor and very tasteful.
reviews.title: Beautiful place - service could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was just gorgeous, big bath and shower and a useful vanity unit in the corner which was perfect for us ladies getting ready! Only criticism was the horrendous noise of the pipes after you flushed the toilet :-)
reviews.title: Good hotel in country location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dining room is most definitely a stunning feature by all accounts with its beautiful ceilings and tasteful decor. Tables are set out allowing you enough space to have a conversation without being overheard but arranged in a way which made the area cosy and comfortable regardless of the amount of guests dining.
reviews.title: The ultimate in service and luxury in a perfect country environment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose starters from the a la carte menu, soup and a goats cheese terrine which although were delicious were very very expensive at £7.50 and £9 respectively. Ouch.
reviews.title: Absolutely gorgeous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at Nunsmere many times and we just love it. Yes it's not cheap (particularly the cost of the breakfasts - £25 each?!!) but in terms of luxury, ambience and a real get away from it all experience, my wife and I absolutely love it.
reviews.title: Our favourite hotel in the whole of the UK
Disappointed
reviews.text: The bedrooms are absolutely magnificent...luxurious and opulent...and we feel really special staying in them.
Dinner in the restaurant is always fantastic with some of the tastiest English food we have ever tasted and all in all, we both think this hotel is almost superb in every way.
reviews.title: Fabulous venue - top class food, service & management
terrible service
reviews.text: Why almost? Well, the breakfast cost is one and the other (only) problem is that when you want a drink there never seems to be anyone at the bar, we always seem to have to go to reception to ask them to get someone to serve us which really isn't good enough for what you pay to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise it is a fantastic hotel...romantic, luxurious and in a beautiful setting.
reviews.title: fantastic,amazing,wonderful

reviews.text: We held our wedding reception here at the end of April 2010.
reviews.title: Once in a lifetime

reviews.text: The first time we visited Nunsmere was one Sunday lunch time, having spent a dispiriting full day on the Saturday and all Sunday morning being thoroughly disappointed by the standard of offer and customer service at other local hotels. The options were limited and totally unsuited to our plans for a stylish, black tie evening event. And then we spotted Nunsmere Hall, as we were driving home.
reviews.title: "First Class Service"

reviews.text: We drove into beautiful grounds and ventured into the impressive lobby. As we were greeted at Reception, we were asked if we were booked in for lunch; already liking the ambience we decided to give it a go, since it’s a great way to test a hotel. It turned out to be a Jazz lunch, and the standard of music and food were exceptional – and the customer service complemented both superbly.
reviews.title: Brilliant service in a beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we arranged to meet Becky to discuss a possible booking, and our pleasure in the venue grew. From choosing the room for the event, our bridal suite, the menu, layout and order of events, Becky and the staff could not have been more helpful. The sommelier advice we received was peerless – in fact we so enjoyed that discussion that as we drove home that afternoon we rang the hotel back to arrange to go for dinner that evening!
reviews.title: very nice, but its the little things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the final run up, Becky continued to be patient, helpful and cheerful. Despite knowing that she manages a busy schedule, we always felt that our event was personally important to her and trusted her without reservation. On the day there wasn’t a single glitch – the staff were tremendous – good-natured, helpful, warm.
reviews.title: A little piece of luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Nunsmere through Groupon and it was sold as a luxury suite for £139 (bed & breakfast for 2) instead of £367. Frankly it was overpriced at £139. The suite was not luxury it was just a big room with peeling wallpaper and a cracked ceiling. The champagne on arrival was a half a bottle of a make I did not recognise. The evening meal was ok but not value for money and the 28 day matured steak was no better than Tesco’s. Breakfast was bad. The self serve buffet was very sparse. The full English was miserly portions.
reviews.title: Motorbike and Wedding Alert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However the worst part of the overnight stay was the noise. Motor bike noise from nearby Oulton Park all afternoon ruined an afternoon in the much advertised grounds and shouting and screaming from several functions until gone 4 on the Sunday morning did not contribute to the “tranquil haven" which is how it was described on the website. I understand that party goers want to have fun but the hotel owners should also have consideration for their sleeping guests.
reviews.title: Lovely building, needs a little more attention to detail, great dinner, ok bfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nobody was bothered at the time and in the morning we were blamed for booking through Groupon. The logic was that we booked through Groupon, Groupon booked a junior suite and that is where the junior suites are. No apology. I told the reception that I would relate my experience on Trip Advisor and lo and behold the next day I received a telephone call from the manager offering apologies which in my opinion was too little too late.
reviews.title: A wonderful Christmas break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not recommended.
reviews.title: excellent customer service in all areas excellent food fantastic staff

reviews.text: beautiful building, lovely room. missing light bulbs, door bell broken ( and so room service just left - didn't try knocking.....) Had some great service and some awful service - very staff member dependant. Lovely dinner, but v little atmosphere- all whispers and piano concerto background muzak. Could be so much better so easily (some jazz or light vocal, fire in the grate etc etc). Breakfast limited and only ok - bfast chef not up to standard. had the same 2 days running and were completely different. staff were very noisy chattering and clattering when we were only ones left at the end of bfast. Felt disrespectful to be honest.. needs focus back on attention to detail and some atmosphere creation for those under 80...
reviews.title: On my way to Wilmslow - Nice Hotel (but slightly overpriced...)
